author: dimitri777
title: Kandy Community Hub
description: There is no hub in Kandy

f6_assessments.q0:
This idea wants to build a hub in Kandy, Sri Lanka, to allow individuals to join in and connect with one another, so building networks and generating emergent energy among all participants. 

However, the proposer should offer additional information so that the community can determine the extent of impact. First, the proposer should do research on the Kandy community's degree of blockchain understanding. If there is a lack of awareness of blockchain, then building blockchain events should take precedence over creating Cardano ecosystem events. Second, why Jaffna rather than another city? What if the Kandy community is indifferent about Cardano? Lastly, the proposer was ADA holder in Circle V3, VCA and CA work in previous funds does not really mean he is competent in delivering and sharing content in such topic. 

Overall, more information should be delivered to better assess project's impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan outlines the actions that will take place during the next three months. The money's usage is clearly indicated in terms of how it will be used. 

A marketing plan to recruit participants, on the other hand, should be outlined. Furthermore, I believe the proposer should predict further issues that may arise and how to cope with them. What if, for example, people decline to join the core group and contribute ideas? What if members simply attend the meetups to be rewarded rather than actually contribute to the hub? What if the number of attendees drops after one month and they prefer online meetings, resulting in a redundancy in rental costs? 

Overall, there may be several obstacles that might hinder project implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The information on how the proposer intends to measure progress is unclear and difficult to understand. The proposer should define clear success metrics/KPIs (how many core members, sub members are successful?) and outline a detailed mechanism for tracking performance. I also propose creating a concentrated source for the community to keep track of events such as social media participation, attendee Q&A, and so on throughout the planning and organizing process.

f6_assessments.q0:
Note: This proposal is one of two copy paste proposals. Hence the assessment rationale for each is essentially the same. I have read both in detail and examined external references. The assessments were reviewed and confirmed before submitting.

Though the idea of community hubs is beneficial. Unless they are enthusiastically operated, with consistency, and managed effectively the impact would be questionable. 

This proposal is one of 50 by the same proposer, using the same human resource and one of two that are almost exact copy paste versions to set up community hubs in Sri Lanka. 

Problem
no hub in jaffna
Summarize your solution to the problem
start Jaffna hub

Problem statement
There is no hub in Kandy
Summarize your solution to the problem
I want to setup a hub in Colombo. 

Both proposals lack enough information to offer positive assessments. 

The proposal statements (for each) offer two completely different types of hubs - either in person or online, but both ask for $20,000 budgets to establish physical hubs.

"Will use the funds to establish a community hub. This will contain resources to help people learn about Cardano and Catalyst. Depending on Covid, this maybe physical location or online meetings. Either way people will be encouraged to meet frequently in order to learn about Catalyst."

Both ask for $1,000 budgets to set up locations for  physical locations, even though activities may be online. Both ask for $10,000 to organize meetings though they may be online. Both ask for $3000 to incentivize people to join, without explaining what incentives are and would do. Both ask for $3000 contingencies. Budgets are exactly the same  with no benefits for common expenses. 

"Getting a location 3 months 1000 USD
Costs of organizing meetups for 3 months 10000
Incentivizing new joiners 3000 USD
Social Media Campaign 3000
Contingency 3000
Total 20000"
There is not explanation of a social media campaign that will cost $3,000.
There is no explanation of what "incentives" might be and how an incentive program might be implemented and a realistic cost-benefit comparison. 

Lacking important useful information and questionable scope of implementation, I am unable to give a positive rating.

f6_assessments.q2:
Note: This proposal is one of two copy paste proposals. Hence the assessment rationale for each is essentially the same. I have read both in detail and examined external references. 

The proposal offers confusing goals - online or in person community hubs. Does not explain what a physical community hub would look like, or how it would be staffed. Does not explain what a $3,000 social media campaign would be. Does not explain how $3,000 of incentives would be used, or accounted for. Finally the proposal mentions several people (the same people who are mentioned on many/most of 50 other proposals) but it does not explain who would do what in relation to in-person or online meetings. There is insufficient information presented to allow me to give a positive assessment.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a cardano community hub in Colombo. They plan to organize physical meetups as well as local meetups. I think that this is a good idea and if well executed, will add value to the cardano ecosystem. Furthermore the proposers have included key metrics that are in line with the challenge settings. However, the proposers can improve the proposal in order to increase their chances of being funded. I suggest to the proposer to add more metrics regarding the online meetups and how they intend to build a social media following. In the long run, this will help scale and selfstain the proposal. Because I’m a digital marketer, I know that building a loyal social media following will open many doors.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have done a good job providing information on the team. They have included the links of the linkedin profiles of the team members. This is a good thing as it increases the confidence in the execution of the project. They also have added a budget breakdown which can be improved by bringing more precisions. For example the cost of meetups in 3 months and the social media campaigns costs can be broken down further. I also recommend to the proposers to be more specific on the type of content they intend to deliver. This will ensure that they can be more precise on the audience they should target. Altogether, I think that this proposal is feasible although there is room for improvements.
f6_assessments.q2: I think that this proposal is auditable because the proposer has provided the necessary information. They have provided a roadmap that is spread in 3 months. I recommend to the proposer to provide a roadmap of 3 , 6 and 12 months worth of activities to gather more information as 3 month is a really small window of time to operate. Moreover, I suggest to the proposers to add stronger metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal. Altogether, I think that the proposal can be auditable but it can be improved as well, to increase the chances of getting funded.

The activities to be carried out to achieve the proposal intent is full of blurriness and cannot tell what exactly is going to be done
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPIs are not vividly stated to justify why the funds are needed to grow the ecosystem. Though in some instances, new members could be identified, there should numbers to help make auditing easier.

There is also no sustainability plan in place to ensure the hub is well organized after funding and execution of task for results.
